p: At last, in the past five years, several papers have been published demonstrating that self-medication is not only present in higher vertebrates, but also it is taxonomically widespread in insects. A summary of cases that convincingly demonstrated self-medication within several different, distantly-related, insect taxa indicated that most representative examples to date are on wooly bear caterpillars ( Grammia rambur), armyworms ( Spodoptera guen√©e), fruit flies ( Drosophila melanogaster), and monarch butterflies ( Danaus plexippus Kluk). In these species, all four criteria for demonstrating self-medication have been met [ 18].
